results.title: Full of Life
results.media_note: Sorry, we don't have images or video for this item.

results.title: Coping (Captioned)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Full of Life”.
This is part of series designed for use by upper secondary students and school leavers. The transition from being a student to a working young adult seeking independence can be fraught with unexpected responsibilities and financial problems. This program describes what to expect once you begin working, together with hints on basic survival techniques and personal budgeting.

results.title: Keep moving (Captioned)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Full of Life”.
Promotes the importance of regular exercise including the positive effects of physical exertion and eating the correct foods. Designed to trigger young people’s interest in wanting to include exercise as a regular part of a balanced lifestyle.

results.title: Outside in...Skin (Captioned)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Full of Life”.
This program looks at the various things that affect our skin. Topics covered include the structure of the skin, the purpose of the skin and the things that influence the state of our skins such as diet, hygiene, age and sun. This program aims to encourage young people to adopt a healthy, balanced way of living. Rated: G.

results.title: Fuelling Up
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Full of Life”.
This program aims to teach young people that diet does not mean the complete denial of nice things to eat, but rather the controlled, planned intake of good quality food - the fuel necessary to power life. Rated: G

results.title: Death of a legend
results.creator_credit: Bill Mason, Barrie Howells and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The Wolf is an endangered species in Canada, threatened by man and his technology, largely because of unfounded myths that have grown up around it. This study attempts to disprove the fallacies, showing the wolf’s life cycle, the social organisation of the pack and the wolf’s role in maintaining the balance of nature. (Awards: Toronto; New York; Brussels)

results.title: Dear diary
results.creator_credit: David Shepard, Debra Franco and Copperfield Films
results.brief_description: Companion film to “Am I normal?” Raising issues and answering questions relating to female puberty, in a humorous and entertaining manner. Provides information on body changes, maturation, peer pressure and self-image. TEACHER PREVIEW RECOMMENDED.

results.title: Out: stories of lesbian and gay youth
results.creator_credit: David Adkin, Silva Basmajian and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: This film explodes some of the myths that provide the foundation for homophobia. It offers insight into the world of several gay and lesbian youth and looks at the people in their lives, identifying some of the difficulties gay youth face. The film attempts to break the damaging silence surrounding sexual orientation and sexual differences.

results.title: Dealing with Discipline Problems (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Jim Thornton and Dave Bell Associates
results.brief_description: A dozen discipline situations filmed at three of Dr Glasser’s model “schools without failure” demonstrates how teachers apply “success concepts” of reality therapy in everyday practice.
